English.string: Welcome to Frantek
Frank has just landed in a city he knows very well. Not much has changed, but it's nothing like he remembered.
One Way or Another
Zack discovers that his wife is in trouble and sets out to rescue her. It's risky, but he has no choice.
An Unlikely Hero
The city isn't safe and the group know that. What they don't know is that danger is around every corner.
One Way Ticket
After Ranjit leads the group to a train station, it seems like a way out is closer than ever before.
Final Destination
Zack joins Frank in his mission to reach his family. It's a friendly gesture, but the consequences are dire.

and {0}% of players
You{0} told the truth about Desmond
You{0} lied about Desmond
You{0} told Zack not to shoot the taxi driver
You{0} told Zack to shoot the taxi driver
You{0} reassured Zack outside the store
You{0} discomforted Zack outside the store
You{0} told Zack your name
You{0} didn't tell Zack your name
You{0} killed Paula's boyfriend
You{0} didn't kill Paula's boyfriend
You{0} left Mary a message
You{0} didn't leave Mary a message
You{0} killed Zack's wife
You{0} didn't kill Zack's wife
You{0} killed Mary
You{0} asked Zack to kill Mary
An update is available
Loading
Welcome to From Zero.
You can move forward by pressing ~KEY_MOVE_FORWARD~.
You can pick up items with the ~KEY_INVENTORY_PICK~ key.
You can shoot by pressing ~KEY_WEAPON_FIRE~.
You can press ~KEY_WEAPON_RELOAD~ to reload. If your clip empties, you will automatically reload.
Upon death, you will be reset to the nearest checkpoint in the story.
You will lose all inventory items except for your pistol, which cannot be dropped or lost.
You can sprint by holding the ~KEY_MOVE_SPRINT~ key.
~c~[Intercom Beeps]
FLIGHT ATTENDANT: Ladies and gentlemen,
we will shortly be arriving to Frantek City Airport, terminal 5.
We would once again like to apologise
for the disruption earlier in the flight
but, would like to inform all passengers that
everything is alright.
TAXI DRIVER: Wouldn't expect this kind of weather in June, would 'ya?
FRANK: Not at all.
I've never seen anything like this, actually.
TAXI DRIVER: So where can I take 'ya?
FRANK: Uh ... Mariana Boulevard, please.
The one near St. John's?
TAXI DRIVER: Say no more.
TAXI DRIVER: You have a familiar accent.
You from here?
I used to live here
It's not important
FRANK: Yeah, I grew up here, but don't live here any more.
TAXI DRIVER: Ha ha! Good ol' cabbie instinct.
FRANK: It's not really that important.
TAXI DRIVER: Ah, sorry. Intruding again.
Still trying to learn boundaries.
TAXI DRIVER: I can't say much, but it's pretty ballsy of you to come here now.
FRANK: Why?
TAXI DRIVER: Everything's breaking down.
You've got people fearing their lives for ... nothing.
You see it plastered all over the news: "STAY HOME.. IT'S NOT SAFE OUTSIDE".
FRANK: Is it true?
TAXI DRIVER: I don't know. Though there's been a lot of
reports lately about just ... random, unprovoked, attacks.
I choose not to think about it.
You have a scratch on you
It's just a hoax
FRANK: You have a mark on your arm.
TAXI DRIVER: Thanks for noticing.
It's not entirely something I'm proud of.
FRANK: It's probably all a hoax.
TAXI DRIVER: (SIGHS) I wish, but I don't know.
TAXI DRIVER: I was bringing this guy home yesterday.
He was so pale, like someone had drained the blood out of him.
He'd been drinking with a group of friends.
They got worried for him, so called
a cab and slipped me a fifty to get him home safe.
I wasn't gonna complain.
He didn't say a word the entire ride.
Got there, tried to wake him up, but he just wouldn't respond.
It took three of us, just random people off the street, to drag him out.
He was just dead weight.
FRANK: Was he alright?
TAXI DRIVER: Sure. I guess.
After we got him out, something just clicked inside of him.
He started going crazy.
He went for me, just started scraping at me.
At one point he bit me. Hence.
FRANK: Does it hurt?
TAXI DRIVER: I went to the doctors this morning. They said it'll be fine
as long as I keep putting some expensive cream on it.
Does it work? Hah, not at all.
FRANK: Oh, come on. Is there a quicker way we can get there?
It's important.
TAXI DRIVER: Don't sweat it. I'll drive 'round here.
Should take us to the other side. It'll cost ya, though.
FRANK: Whatever it takes.
TAXI DRIVER: Alright, buckle up!
TAXI DRIVER: I actually used to play around here when I was a kid.
It used to be me ..
Francis ..
and ...
Clara ...
Who's Clara?
Are you okay?
I don't care
FRANK: Who's Clara?
FRANK: Are you okay, sir?
FRANK: Look, I don't mean to sound rude ...
... but I really don't care.
TAXI DRIVER: Clara ...
She's ...
She was ...
FRANK: I don't understand what is happening!
Who is Cla---
Help!
Are you okay?
FRANK: Help!
Two men injured!
Please send help!
FRANK: Sir?
Are you alright?
Please respond!
FRANK: You're alright?
I need to find some help.
Don't move too much.
What do you want from me?
Please just respond to me!
I need to find help.
~c~[Taxi Driver Growls]
ZACK: You have exactly three seconds to tell me why you are in my house.
I need help!
I was scared!
Something is wrong!
FRANK: I need help!
FRANK: I was scared!
FRANK: Something isn't right!
I was just in a taxi. My driver collapsed and we hit a tree.
I'm not too bad but he's seriously injured.
ZACK: Where were you going?
FRANK: To see my family, up in St. John's.
ZACK: Listen to me.
Something weird is going on.
I don't know what.
You have to stay here for now. My wife gets home in about two hours.
I'll take you to your family myself.
Just ... don't go outside.
What is going on?
Why should I trust you?
Why are you helping me?
FRANK: What is going on?
ZACK: I don't know.
It's not safe outside right now, and you don't have a car.
Trust me here.
FRANK: Why should I trust you?
ZACK: You don't have to. But it'd be stupid not to.
FRANK: Why are you helping me?
I mean, I literally just broke into your house.
ZACK: Because numbers are power.
Like they keep saying, don't be alone.
Especially not these days.
Anyway, I have some stuff to go sort out.
Don't touch anything.
~c~[Telephone Rings]
ZACK: Change of plans. We have to go now.
FRANK: What's wrong?
ZACK: My wife just called. Something's going on outside her work.
Look, we can talk about this on the way.
We have to--
DESMOND: Help me! Please help me!
Please, you have to help me!
ZACK: Who are you?
ZACK: Do you know this guy?
[TRUTH] No!
[LIE] Yes!
FRANK: Yeah ... he was ... he was with me in the taxi.
We said we'd carpool to St John's.
FRANK: No, I've never seen this guy in my life.
FRANK: That's the guy! The taxi driver!
How did he get here?
DESMOND: Please! You have to help me!
There are things out here!
I don't know what's going on.
~c~[Desmond Screams]
ZACK: Hey! Hey! Get off him!
I'll shoot you, I swear.
FRANK: Don't go out there! That guy's clearly insane.
We're safer in here.
ZACK: Hey! Stay back!
I swear to God, I will shoot you!
Shoot him!
Don't shoot him!
FRANK: Shoot him!
FRANK: Don't shoot him!
ZACK: What am I doing?!
Do what you want with that, I don't want it.
FRANK: You.. you shot him.
ZACK: Do you think I can't see that? I know what I did.
You told me to do it!
FRANK: He doesn't look ... right.
ZACK: I don't care any more.
Meet me outside. We have to get Abby.
~c~[Telephone Rings]
~c~[Answer Machine Beeps]
ABBY: Zack... baby, it's me.
It's too late, please stay home.
Do what the news says.
I love you, Zack.
I love you.
~c~[Telephone Disconnects]
ZACK: I just hope she's alright.
I knew I shouldn't have let her go to work today.
Something was wrong.
She'll be alright.
I don't know.
FRANK: She'll be alright.
I don't know her very well, but she sounds like a smart woman.
Don't worry.
FRANK: Based on what happened today, I don't know what to believe.
ZACK: She knows how to defend herself, but she wouldn't hurt a fly.
FRANK: Where does she work, anyway?
ZACK: There.
This isn't right.
Why are all of these people out here in the middle of the night?
FRANK: I don't think they're people.
I mean, they look like people but ...
They seem ... sick?
I can't really tell from here.
ZACK: We need to get them away from there.
Whoa, you actually brought that?
Oh God. This can't be happening.
[REASSURING RESPONSE]
[DISCOURAGING RESPONSE]
FRANK: Don't worry, I know what I'm doing.
ZACK: Okay ... I trust you.
FRANK: I've never shot a gun before.
ZACK: Okay ... sure.
What could possibly go wrong?
ZACK: Just please be careful.
ZACK: They're coming!
Keep shooting, it's working!
FRANK: This clip isn't gonna last forever!
We need to keep moving.
ZACK: Okay, okay. Let me see if I can figure something out.
FRANK: Got anything?!
~c~[Zack Heaves]
ZACK: No, nothing will budge!
FRANK: I don't know how many more rounds I've got!
We have to move!
ZACK: Got it! This way, quick!
Shoot at the horde of zombies to distract them.
Stay safe and play time whilst Zack finds an escape.
ZACK: I'm gonna look for something to barricade this with.
See if you can find us another way out of here.
I'm Zack, by the way.
I'm Frank
I don't care
FRANK: Frank.
ZACK: Nice to meet you, Frank.
FRANK: I didn't ask.
ZACK: Alright. Nice to meet you too, asswipe.
FRANK: I'll see what I can find.
RADIO: ... we were unable to reach out to the military for comment.
It seems that we are well and truly ... [SIGHS] ... on our own.
Please remain tuned for updates.
Stay safe, and may God save us all.
ZACK: Is everything alright in there?
FRANK: Yeah, just another of those things.
FRANK: Maybe that guy had a key.
FRANK: Found a door. Ready when you are.
ZACK: This should lead us straight to her.
How are you holding up?
I'm good
I've seen better days
I'm not
FRANK: I'm good.
FRANK: I've seen better days.
FRANK: I'm not.
ZACK: As soon as we get there, we'll make sure she's safe
and head towards your family.
You've done more than enough to save mine.
FRANK: How long have you been married?
ZACK: Coming on three years. Had a holiday booked for August.
The Maldives.
Do you think travel insurance has an "end of the world" clause?
FRANK: I doubt it.
ZACK: She would've locked this. We're too late.
Clear a path to the store.
ZACK: Oh.. no. Please don't be.
Abby? ABBY?
FRANK: Zack. I am so sorry.
ABBY: Zack! I never expected to hear your voice!
ZACK: Abby! I thought that body was you.
ABBY: No, that's Claudia. Or, was?
ZACK: I'm so glad you're okay!
ABBY: Zack, what is going on? Who is this guy?
ZACK: I met him a few hours ago.
He told me something had been chasing him.
He told me he needed help.
He told me he was scared.
He told me something wasn't right.
I don't actually know his name. He's a bit of a clown.
But I have to applaud him.
He's the reason I'm here with you now.
His name's Frank. He's a good guy.
FRANK: There's something weird going on. I don't know what.
ABBY: Where is your family?
I don't know
Not too far away
I don't have a family
FRANK: I don't know.
FRANK: Not too far away from here.
FRANK: I don't have a family.
~c~[Screaming]
ZACK: Who is that?
ABBY: Oh my God! Paula!
[INTERVENE]
[DO NOTHING]
PAULA: You shot Dan! I can't believe it!
FRANK: Listen to me... that wasn't him.
I don't know what that thing was, but it wasn't who you think.
I'm so sorry about your loss, but he was already dead.
ABBY: What? Zack, do you hear this guy?!
ZACK: He's right, Abby. Those things ... they're not us.
When did he turn?
I'm sorry
Who was he?
FRANK: When did he start acting like this?
ABBY: He said he was attacked on the way here.
We told him to call the police but he said it was engaged.
That's impossible.
FRANK: I'm sorry for you all.
ZACK: Your family is the next one to be saved.
For Paula's sake, we can't lose more people today.
FRANK: Who was Dan?
ABBY: Paula's boyfriend.
ZACK: We have to go. The gunshot probably lured even more of them back here.
Where's your car, honey?
ABBY: It's parked out back, same spot as usual.
ZACK: Alright. Everyone ready to go?
ABBY: Paula, I'm so sorry.
That wasn't Dan.
PAULA: I just can't lose him. Not now, you know?
ABBY: I know, Pea. I'm sorry. I really am.
But we have to go, or we'll be just like him.
PAULA: Maybe it's better if I am!
ABBY: Please! I need you with me.
This is hard enough already, please come.
PAULA: Oh Abby, for you I'd do anything. You know that.
Okay, fine. Just ... let me say my goodbyes?
ZACK: Take your time.
Meet us at the front door when you're ready.
PAULA: Thank you everyone, I'm ready now.
ZACK: Alright, let's roll. We have to keep quiet.
Don't want any more attention than we have already.
~c~[Zombie Horde Growls]
ABBY: Come on ... come on. Ugh!
~c~[Car Alarm Rings]
FRANK: That's the thing we least need right now.
ABBY: Try to hold them off.
I'm gonna get this goddamn door open.
~c~[Paula Screams]
~c~[Car Alarm Stops]
~c~[Vehicle Approaches]
~c~[Door Slides Open]
UNKNOWN: Get in this van and live, or refuse and die.
ZACK: We've got no choice. Get in!
ZACK: I'd just like to make a toast.
Despite the circumstances that we currently face
we wouldn't be here now without either of these two guys.
ABBY: Zack's right. You both saved our lives.
And you
you saved my little Zakkie's life.
I will never forget that.
FRANK: Don't mention it.
ZACK: Alright! Who wants to play another game?
PAULA: Only if you stop cheating.
ZACK: I don't cheat!
RANJIT: Totally caught you earlier, dude.
ABBY: He always cheats. Never changes. I'll start this time.
RANJIT: Morning.
FRANK: (MOANING) What time is it?
RANJIT: Should be around seven, that's usually when I wake up.
FRANK: That's ... early.
RANJIT: Yeah, it's what I had to do.
FRANK: What did you do? You know, before this?
RANJIT: I worked on the rails. Six years, to be precise.
Didn't really care for the job but it paid well.
FRANK: So where are you planning to go?
RANJIT: Anywhere. Everywhere.
I heard there's a safe zone near Philmont Hill.
It's far, but it's the only shot I've got.
You're looking for your family, right?
Yeah
I'm just trying to survive
FRANK: Yeah, I hope they're alright.
FRANK: My priority now is survival.
RANJIT: That's not what you said yesterday.
RANJIT: That's not what your buddy said yesterday.
RANJIT: If I can give you one word of advice, don't stop believing.
You think I believe in the "safe zone"?
It's a myth. I know that.
But I gotta keep dreaming. It's what keeps me going.
I saw an old payphone over there.
Take this, give 'em a ring.
If not for them, for you.
I'll call you when the food's done.
[LEAVE MESSAGE]
[HANG UP]
FRANK: It's me. Frank. I'm coming. I'm so close now.
Just keep holding out. I know you're gonna be alright. I love you.
RANJIT: Alright! Food's ready. Let's eat, then get going!
PAULA: Morning all. Are we still in this nightmare?
ZACK: Seems so.
PAULA: Zack, where's Abby?
ZACK: She was cold last night, said she kept getting the shakes.
Went inside to keep warm.
I'll take this to her now. See how she's feeling.
PAULA: Want me to come with you?
ZACK: Nah, don't worry about it.
Thanks for the offer though.
PAULA: Did you both sleep well?
RANJIT: As well as can be.
FRANK: Agreed. How about you?
PAULA: I kept having weird visions in the night.
That we were all on a boat, but I was with my fianc--
~c~[Plate Smashes]~n~~s~ZACK: ABBY? SPEAK TO ME!
FRANK: What happened? Is she alright?
ZACK: I don't know! I just got here and she was like this.
ABBY: Zack, honey. I didn't tell you back in the store but
that thing, it bit me.
ZACK: What? No! It can't have! What do you mean?
No! No! No!
This is YOUR fault!
You didn't shoot her quick enough!
You didn't even try to shoot her!
FRANK: Look, I --
ABBY: No, Zack. It's not his fault.
It bit me before you even got in the room. I didn't think it was important.
ZACK: I can't.
PAULA: Abby, please tell me this isn't true.
I can't lose two of you in less than a day.
It's too much for me.
ABBY: Paula, you're an amazing friend and I am so sorry about Dan.
I really am.
But I know you're going to make it through this.
I know you. You are strong.
ZACK: Can I ask you something?
RANJIT: We'll give you some space.
ABBY: Goodbye, Paula.
PAULA: I'll miss you, Abby.
ZACK: I'm sorry about earlier.
FRANK: It's alright. I understand.
ZACK: We both know what needs to happen. But I can't do this.
ABBY: What do you mean?
ZACK: Honey, I saw this before.
At the house. There was a guy. He looked as pale as you. He was crazy.
He started attacking some stranger. Biting him, chewing him, eating him alive.
ABBY: But I'm still me, I would never do that! Ever!
FRANK: The guy who attacked him was my taxi driver.
He was bitten too, but he seemed normal at first.
Then, just suddenly, he collapsed at the wheel. We crashed. Hit a tree.
That's when I met your husband.
There is no way that he would have been conscious
enough to crawl to your window and break through it.
Whatever was controlling him; it wasn't him.
ZACK: You have to do this, for me. I don't think I'm man enough.
[ACCEPT]
[DECLINE]
[COMPROMISE]
FRANK: No. You have to do this. It's your wife.
It would be wrong for me. I respect the offer, but I have to refuse.
ABBY: You're a good man. I wish I could've known you more.
Just, please keep my Zack safe.
ZACK: I'm in good hands, Abby.
FRANK: If it's what you want, I'll do it.
ZACK: It's what I want.
FRANK: It won't hurt. I promise.
FRANK: Then leave her here! It doesn't have to end with blood.
ZACK: I'm not letting her become one of those! I refuse.
Please will you do this for me or not?
PAULA: ...wasn't just my friend, but my best friend.
You were my sister, Abby.
We went through so much together. I would do anything to have you back.
We lost an amazing woman today
but her legacy lives on through her amazing husband.
ZACK: Thank you, Paula. That was needed.
RANJIT: They heard the gunshot. We have to get going soon.
ZACK: You guys go ahead, I'll meet you in a bit.
I know I've never believed in the supernatural
but I don't know what to believe any more.
Abby, I have always loved you and I will never stop. I love you.
It is generally ill-advised to stand in fire during an apocalypse.
FRANK: How you holding up?
ZACK: I don't know.
So much has happened in the past twenty-four hours alone
that I ... I don't know any more.
It must be hard for you. I understand.
You're not alone.
FRANK: I understand. It must be hard for you.
I can't imagine how you must feel right now. I'm sorry.
FRANK: You're not alone. You have us, you always will.
I know things aren't particularly good right now, but don't forget that.
ZACK: I just wish we would've got the chance to do everything we wanted.
The holiday, kids, you know? All of it, gone, just like that.
FRANK: It must be tough. At least you got to say goodbye, though.
I don't know what I'm dealing with.
ZACK: Whatever it is, you're not alone either.
You've stood by me through all of this
even with your family just a few miles out.
I'm not leaving you. Not now.
RANJIT: There she is. That's our way out of here.
PAULA: There's so many of them. What do we do?
RANJIT: Alright, we need to split up.
I want you to come with me.
The two of you, I want you to sneak around the back.
We'll push from both sides and we'll meet in the middle.
PAULA: Alright, let's do this.
ZACK: Actually ... do you mind if I sit this one out?
It's just that ... seeing all those things ... it's killing me.
PAULA: Is that alright?
I'll stay here with him, you two can go?
RANJIT: So much for that plan. Uhm ... sure.
You two stay here, keep an eye for anything coming. People, monsters--
ZACK: They're not monsters!
Please ... don't call them that.
RANJIT: Sorry.
Ready?
FRANK: Ready.
RANJIT: Good work there.
Started pretty nasty but you're a good shot.
Alright, we just need to board the train
make our way through to the cabin, and then I can start driving.
PAULA: Do you even know how to drive a train?
RANJIT: I know what I'm doing. Let's get going.
It's not like we're the quietest people around here.
RANJIT: Unless they know how to open doors, this'll keep 'em out.
~c~[Train Doors Beep]
~c~[Train Engines Whirr]
ZACK: What's happening?
PAULA: Why are we moving?
RANJIT: That's impossible. Unless...
We have to get to that cabin. NOW!
RANJIT: Looks like we even have our own driver.
PAULA: What's happening?
RANJIT: I pulled him off the controls. We're braking.
We'll be at St. John's in about two minutes. I'll drop you off there
then head out of the city with whoever else wants to stay.
ZACK: I'll be getting off as well.
PAULA: I'm staying. I'm sorry, Zack, I know you've been through so much today
and I can't even begin to empathise with you, but I truly am sorry.
I just want to escape at this point.
FRANK: It's alright. You have your reasons. I'll keep him safe.
PAULA: Thank you.
FRANK: I guess this is it.
ZACK: Thank you, both of you, you're really special people to me.
I hope you manage to find somewhere safe.
PAULA: Thank you, Zack. We will. I trust this guy.
RANJIT: I'll keep her safe.
Just ... promise me you'll keep him safe.
He looks distressed. He needs someone for
him right now.
ZACK: I'm fine.
FRANK: I'll make sure. Don't worry.
RANJIT: Alright. See you boys around.
FRANK: Have a safe journey. Good luck.
PAULA: Be safe, guys.
ZACK: You too.
FRANK: Where did you get that?
ZACK: Found it while we were outside.
I'm not scared any more.
I have to prove it.
You don't have to prove anything
If that's your choice
FRANK: You don't have to prove anything.
I don't care about who you are or what you can do.
I just care that you're safe.
FRANK: If that's your choice.
ZACK: Let's do this.
ZACK: I needed that.
FRANK: You alright?
ZACK: It helped.
FRANK: They live just around the corner. I hope they're alright.
ZACK: Whatever happens ...
FRANK: Please don't say anything.
ZACK: Sorry.
FRANK: Hello? Hello? Is anyone there?
ZACK: I'll go look around. I'll let you know if I see anything.
FRANK (V.O): It's meeee! Flight's just arrived, about to board.
Will be there soon. Can't wait. Love you!
FRANK (V.O): It's me again. I've just touched down.
Something really strange happened on the flight.
Some guy started attacking people. They had to restrain him.
I'll tell you about it when I get home.
Just know that I'm safe, and that I miss you.
ZACK: You might want to see this.
ZACK: I don't know who this is, but ...
FRANK: Mary? Is that you?
Please talk to me.
I just... I just want to hear your voice one last time.
Remember when I was a kid? And I'd always get in trouble?
And you'd always start shouting at me in that weird accent so I'd laugh?
Please. I need to hear that one last time. Don't leave me now.
ZACK: I'm...
FRANK: IT'S NOT FAIR! IT'S JUST NOT FAIR!
ZACK: I know ... I'm so sorry. But please, keep your voice down.
FRANK: AT LEAST YOU GOT TO SEE YOUR FAMILY BEFORE THEY DIED.
IT'S HORRIBLE, I KNOW, BUT I NEVER EVEN GOT TO SAY GOODBYE.
MARY: Frank? Is that you?
FRANK: SHE'S IN MY HEAD. SHE WON'T LEAVE MY HEAD, ZACK. I CAN HEAR HER.
ZACK: No. I heard that too.
She was calling your name.
FRANK: THE CELLAR! I HAVE TO GET TO THE CELLAR!
JASON: Is that you?
FRANK: Jason? Mother? You're both here ... you're still alive!
MARY: Frank ... come here.
FRANK: Why are you putting on that voice?
JASON: She's not putting on a voice, Frank.
FRANK: Yes ... yes she is. She sounds sick. She's not sick!
MARY: Frank, I love you so much.
FRANK: What is that? No! No! No! Please!
Tell me that's not what I think it is.
JASON: I'm sorry, brother. They broke in the house, we tried to
fight them but they just kept coming.
They attacked us and we had to lock ourselves in here.
ZACK: When did she get bitten?
JASON: About ten hours ago. Why?
ZACK: I'm so sorry.
JASON: Frank? What is he talking about?
FRANK: HE'S LYING. HE DOESN'T MEAN ANYTHING HE SAYS.
ZACK: Frank...
JASON: What do you mean?
ZACK: My wife ... she was bitten.
In less than a day she'd become one of those things.
Your mother's been bitten for a while.
I'm so sorry but she doesn't have long left.
FRANK: DON'T LISTEN TO HIM. NOTHING HE'S SAYING IS TRUE.
MARY: Frank ... I know what's happening. Your friend isn't lying.
I'm just glad that I got to hear your voice one last time.
JASON: We both are.
FRANK: WHAT IF WE ... WE CAN FIX THIS ... ALL WE NEED TO DO IS --
MARY: There's no time for that, Frank.
I've come to terms with whatever's coming.
You're my second son, but I love you just as much as Jason.
I love you both.
FRANK: I LOVE YOU TOO.
MARY: Frank, can you promise me something?
FRANK: ANYTHING.
MARY: Don't let me come back as one of those.
I want to die who I am and I want it to stay that way.
FRANK: NO! NO! I CAN'T DO THAT. ANYTHING ELSE, PLEASE.
MARY: You're the only one with a gun, Frank. We're unarmed in here.
Please, for me, fulfil my last wish.
FRANK: I CAN'T.
JASON: I know we've just met, but would you do it?
Neither of us want her to change. We want to remember her as she was.
ZACK: I would. But it's Frank's decision.
I asked him to kill my wife for me when she was in the same state.
He did it for me.
He refused to do it.
I'm grateful for what he did.
[KILL MARY]
[DON'T KILL MARY].
FRANK: I'll do it! Please. Just give me a minute.
FRANK: Zack! Please do this for me. I can't.
MARY: Jason. Frank. My sons. I love you both so much.
Whatever's happening in this world, please don't let it stop you.
I need you to fight them. For me.
JASON: We will.
FRANK: I love you so much.
MARY: I love you too, son.
FRANK: I love you.
ZACK: WHAT ARE YOU DOING?
NO, YOU CAN'T DO THAT!
PUT IT --

Italian.string: Frank e' appena atterrato in una citta' che conosce bene. Non e' cambiato molto, sebbene tutto sembra diverso.
Sei sicuro di voler tornare al menu principale?
Sei sicuro di voler chiudere il gioco?
Le impostazioni non possono essere cambiate durante il gioco. Sei sicuro di voler tornare al menu principale?
Giocare un episodio precedente resettera' tutti i progressi fatti oltre quell'episodio. Questo portera' a completare l'episodio di nuovo da zero.~n~~n~Sei sicuro di voler continuare?

Stai per resettare i tuoi progressi, ricominciando dall'inizio del seguente episodio. Questo fara' si che tutte le scelte fatte in quest'episodio saranno resettate.~n~~n~Sei sicuro di voler continuare?
Puoi muoverti in avanti premendo il tasto ~KEY_MOVE_FORWARD~.
Puoi raccogliere oggetti con il tasto ~KEY_INVENTORY_PICK~.
Puoi premere ~KEY_WEAPON_RELOAD~ per ricaricare. Se finisci le munizioni, ricaricherai automaticamente.
Una volta ferito, la storia sara' resettata fino al checkpoint piu' vicino.
Perderai tutti gli oggetti tranne la pistola.
Puoi usare lo sprint premendo il tasto ~KEY_MOVE_SPRINT~.
ASSISTENTE DI VOLO: Signore e signori,
stiamo per atterrare all'aereoporto di Frantek City, terminal 5.
per i precedenti disagi durante il volo
ma, vorremmo informare tutti i passeggeri che
TASSISTA: Non ti aspetteresti mai questo tempo in Giugno, vero?
Al dire il vero, non ho mai visto nulla del genere.
FRANK: Si, sono cresciuto qui, ma mi sono trasferito.
TASSISTA: Ha ha! Buon vecchio istinto da tassista.
TASSISTA: Ah, scusa. Mi stavo intromettendo di nuovo.
Sto ancora imparando a mantenere le distanze.
TASSISTA: Non posso dirti molto, ma corraggioso da parte tua tornare qui ora.
TASSISTA: Stanno succedendo molte cose strane.
La gente teme per le proprie vite a causa di ... niente.
Tutti i telegiornali dicono: "RESTATE A CASA.. NON E' SICURO FUORI".
TAXI DRIVER: Non lo so. Sebbene ci sono molte
voci che raccontano di ... casuali, ingiustificati, attacchi.
FRANK: Hai un graffio sul braccio.
Non qualcosa di cui sono molto fiero.
TASSISTA: (SOSPIRA) Lo spero, ma non so.
TASSISTA: Ieri stavo portando questo ragazzo a casa.
Era molto pallido, come se qualcuno gli avesse succhiato via il sangue.
Erano preoccupati per lui, cos hanno chiamato
un taxi e mi hanno dato 50 verdoni per portarlo a casa sano e salvo.
Il tipo non ha detto una parola per tutto il tempo.
Arrivati l, ho provato a svegliarlo, ma non rispondeva.
Ci sono volute 3 persone, a cui ho chiesto aiuto per strada, per tirarlo fuori dal taxi.
Una volta fuori dalla macchina, scattato qualcosa in lui .
Ha iniziato a dare di matto.
Mi ha preso, e ha iniziato a graffiarmi.
Allora, ad un certo punto mi ha morso.
TASSISTA: Sono andato dal dottore stamattina. Ha detto che migliorer
se continuo a mettere una crema sulla ferita.
FRANK: Oh, dai. Non c' una via pi veloce?
Dovrebbe portarci dall'altro lato. Ma ti coster.
TASSISTA: Quando ero un bambino ero solito giocare da queste parti.
FRANK: Guarda, non vorrei sembrare maleducato...
FRANK: Non capisco cosa sta succedendo!
ZACK: Hai esattamente tre secondi per dirmi perch sei in casa mia.
Ero in un taxi. L'autista collassato e abbiamo colpito un albero.
Io sto bene ma lui sembra gravemente ferito
FRANK: A vedere la mia famiglia, in St. John's.
Devi restare qui per ora. Mia moglie torner a casa in due ore.
Ti aiuter a raggiungere la tua famiglia.
Non sicuro fuori, e tu non hai un auto.
FRANK: Perch dovrei fidarmi di te?
ZACK: Non devi se vuoi. Ma sarebbe stupido se non lo facessi.
Cio, ho appena invaso la tua casa.
ZACK: Perch sono i numeri che contano.
Comunque ho qualcosa di importante da fare ora.
ZACK: Cambio di piani. Dobbiamo andare ora.
ZACK: Mia moglie mi ha appena chiamato. Sta succedendo qualcosa a lavoro.
Senti, possiamo parlarne per la via.
FRANK: Si ... lui era ... lui era con me nel taxi.
Avevamo deciso di divere il taxi per St John's.
FRANK: No, non l'ho mai visto prima.
FRANK: Quello il tipo! Il tassista!
FRANK: Non andare li fuori! Quel tipo pazzo.
Facci quello che vuoi, non la voglio.
ZACK: Pensi che non lo so? So cosa ho fatto.
Tu mi hai detto di farlo!
FRANK: Lui non mi sembra ... vivo.
Incontrami fuori. Dobbiamo andare da Abby.
~c~[Telefono squilla e la segreteria telefonica suona]
E' troppo tardi, resta a casa.
Sapevo che non sarebbe dovuta andare a lavoro oggi.
Non la conosco bene, ma sembra essere una ragazza sveglia.
FRANK: In base a quanto successo oggi, non so a cosa credere.
ZACK: Lei sa come difendersi, ma non farebbe del male a nessuno.
Perche' ci sono tutte queste persone qui nel bel mezzo della notte?
Non riesco a capire da qui.
ZACK: Dobbiamo riuscire a spostarli da li.
Whoa, hai davvero portato la pistola?
Oh dio. Questo non sta succedendo davvero.
FRANK: Non preoccuparti, So quello che faccio.
ZACK: Okay ... Mi fido di te.
FRANK: Non ho mai sparato in vita mia.
ZACK: Okay, okay. Vediamo se posso escogitare qualcosa.
ZACK: No, non riesco ad aprire la porta!
FRANK: Non so quanti colpi mi sono rimasti!
ZACK: Fatto! Per di qua, veloce!
Fai attenzione e segui Zack finche' non trova un posto sicuro.
ZACK: Cerco qualcosa per barricare la porta.
Vedi se puoi trovare un altra uscita.
ZACK: Okay. Piacere di conoscerti anche per me, stronzo.
RADIO: ... non siamo riusciti a metterci in contatto con i militari per informazioni.
Sembra che siamo per davvero ... [SOSPIRA] ... per conto nostro.
State in guardia, spero che dio ci aiuti.
FRANK: Si, solo un altra di quelle "cose".
FRANK: Forse questo tizio aveva una chiave.
FRANK: Ho trovato una chiave. Pronto?
ZACK: Questo dovrebbe portarci dritti al negozio.
ZACK: Quando arriveremo li, ci assicureremo che mia moglie stia bene
e ci dirigeremo verso la tua famiglia.
Hai fatto abbastanza per la mia.
FRANK: Da quanto tempo siete sposati?
ZACK: Tre anni. Avevamo anche una vacanza prenotata ad Agosto.
Pensi che l'assicurazione ha una clausola per "fine del mondo"?
ZACK: Avrebbe dovuto chiudere questa porta. Siamo in ritardo.
Fatti strada tra gli zombie fino al negozio.
